Components.AccordionItem.name: Components.AccordionItem
Components.AccordionItem.description:
A collapsible/expandable item within an accordion

See {{#crossLink "Components.Accordion"}}{{/crossLink}} for examples.

Components.Alert.name: Components.Alert
Components.Alert.description: Implements Bootstrap alerts, see http://getbootstrap.com/components/#alerts By default it is a user dismissible alert with a fade out animation, both of which can be disabled. Be sure to set the `type` property for proper styling. ```hbs {{#bs-alert type="success"}} Well done! You successfully read this important alert message. {{/bs-alert}} ```

Components.Button.name: Components.Button

Components.Collapse.name: Components.Collapse
Components.Collapse.description:
An Ember component that mimics the behaviour of Bootstrap's collapse.js plugin, see http://getbootstrap.com/javascript/#collapse ```hbs {{#bs-collapse collapsed=collapsed}}

Collapse

This is collapsible content

{{/bs-collapse}} ```

Button component with that can act as a dropdown toggler.

See {{#crossLink "Components.Dropdown"}}{{/crossLink}} for examples.

Components.DropdownMenu.name: Components.DropdownMenu

Component for the dropdown menu.

Components.DropdownToggle.name: Components.DropdownToggle
Components.DropdownToggle.description:
Anchor element that triggers the parent dropdown to open.
Use {{#crossLink "Components.DropdownButton"}}{{/crossLink}} if you want a button instead of an anchor tag.

See {{#crossLink "Components.Dropdown"}}{{/crossLink}} for examples.

Components.Dropdown.name: Components.Dropdown

Components.FormElement.name: Components.FormElement

Components.FormGroup.name: Components.FormGroup
Components.FormGroup.description:
This component renders a `<div class="form-group">` element, with support for validation states and feedback icons.
Use as a block level component:

```hbs
{{#bs-form-group validation=firstNameValidation}}
<label class="control-label">First name</label>
{{bs-input type="text" value=firstname}}
{{/bs-form-group}}
```

If the `validation` property is set to some state (usually Bootstrap's predefined states "success",
"warning" or "error"), the appropriate styles will be added, together with a feedback icon.
See http://getbootstrap.com/css/#forms-control-validation

Components.Form.name: Components.Form
Components.Form.description:
Render a form with the appropriate Bootstrap layout class (see `formLayout`).
Allows setting a `model` that nested `Components.FormElement`s can access, and that can provide form validation through
[ember-validations](https://github.com/dockyard/ember-validations)

You can use whatever markup you like within the form:

```hbs
{{#bs-form action="submit"}}
{{#bs-form-group validation=firstNameValidation}}
<label class="control-label">First name</label>
{{bs-input type="text" value=firstname}}
{{/bs-form-group}}
{{/bs-form}}
```

However to benefit from features such as automatic form markup, validations and validation markup, use `Components.FormElement`
as nested components. See below for an example.

### Submitting the form

When the form is submitted (e.g. by clicking a submit button), the event will be intercepted and the default action
will be sent to the controller.
In case the form supports validation (see "Form validation" below), the "before" action is called (which allows you to
do e.g. model data normalization), then the available  validation rules are evaluated, and if those fail, the "invalid"
action is sent instead of the default "action".

### Use with Components.FormElement

When using `Components.FormElement`s with their `property` set to property names of the form's validation enabled
`model`, you gain some additional powerful features:
* the appropriate Bootstrap markup for the given `formLayout` and the form element's `controlType` is automatically generated
* markup for validation states and error messages is generated based on the model's validation (if available), when submitting the form
with an invalid validation, or when focusing out of invalid inputs

```hbs
{{#bs-form formLayout="horizontal" model=this action="submit"}}
{{bs-form-element controlType="email" label="Email" placeholder="Email" property="email"}}
{{bs-form-element controlType="password" label="Password" placeholder="Password" property="password"}}
{{bs-form-element controlType="checkbox" label="Remember me" property="rememberMe"}}
{{bs-button defaultText="Submit" type="primary" buttonType="submit"}}
{{/bs-form}}
```

See the {{#crossLink "Components.FormElement"}}{{/crossLink}} API docs for further information.

### Form validation

All version of ember-bootstrap beginning from 0.7.0 do not come with built-in support for validation engines anymore.
Instead support is added usually by addition Ember addons, for example:

* [ember-bootstrap-validations](https://github.com/kaliber5/ember-bootstrap-validations): adds support for [ember-validations](https://github.com/DockYard/ember-validations)
* [ember-bootstrap-cp-validations](https://github.com/offirgolan/ember-bootstrap-cp-validations): adds support for [ember-cp-validations](https://github.com/offirgolan/ember-cp-validations)

To add your own validation support, you have to:

* extend this component, setting `hasValidator` to true if validations are available (by means of a computed property for example), and implementing the `validate` method
* extend the {{#crossLink "Components.FormElement"}}{{/crossLink}} component and implement the `setupValidations` hook or simply override the `errors` property to add the validation error messages to be displayed

See the above mentioned addons for examples.

classitems.description: The title of the accordion item, displayed as a .panel-title element
classitems.name: title

classitems.description: The value of the accordion item, which is used as the value of the `selected` property of the parent {{#crossLink "Components.Accordion"}}{{/crossLink}} component
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: The value of the currently selected accordion item
classitems.name: selected

classitems.description:
A dismissible alert will have a close button in the upper right corner, that the user can click to dismiss
the alert.
classitems.name: dismissible

classitems.description: If true the alert is completely hidden. Will be set when the fade animation has finished.
classitems.name: dismissed

classitems.description:
This property controls if the alert should be visible. If false it might still be in the DOM until the fade animation
has completed.
classitems.name: visible

classitems.description: Set to false to disable the fade out animation when hiding the alert.
classitems.name: fade

classitems.description:
Computed property to set the alert class to the component div. Will be false when dismissed to have the component
div (which cannot be removed form DOM by the component itself) without any markup.
classitems.name: alert

classitems.description: The duration of the fade out animation
classitems.name: fadeDuration

classitems.description: The action to be sent after the alert has been dismissed (including the CSS transition).
classitems.name: dismissedAction

classitems.description: Call to make the alert visible again after it has been hidden
classitems.name: show

classitems.description:
Call to hide the alert. If the `fade` property is true, this will fade out the alert before being finally
dismissed.
classitems.name: hide

classitems.description: Set to true for a vertically stacked button group, see http://getbootstrap.com/components/#btn-groups-vertical
classitems.name: vertical

classitems.description:
Set to true for the buttons to stretch at equal sizes to span the entire width of its parent. *Important*: You have to wrap every button component in a `div class="btn-group">`: ```handlebars
{{#bs-button}}My Button{{/bs-button}}
``` See http://getbootstrap.com/components/#btn-groups-justified
classitems.name: justified

classitems.description:
The type of the button group specifies how child buttons behave and how the `value` property will be computed:

### null
If `type` is not set (null), the button group will add no functionality besides Bootstrap styling

### radio
if `type` is set to "radio", the buttons will behave like radio buttons:
* the buttons will toggle (`toggle` property of the child buttons will be set to true)
* only one button may be active
* the `value` property of the button group will reflect the `value` property of the active button

### checkbox
if `type` is set to "checkbox", the buttons will behave like checkboxes:
* the buttons will toggle (`toggle` property of the child buttons will be set to true)
* any number of buttons may be active
* the `value` property of the button group will be an array containing the `value` properties of all active buttons
classitems.name: type

classitems.description:
The value of the button group, computed by its child buttons.
See the {{#crossLink "Button-Group/type:attribute"}}`type` property{{/crossLink}} for how the value property is constructed.

When you set the value, the corresponding buttons will be activated:
* use a single value for a radio button group to activate the button with the same value
* use an array of values for a checkbox button group to activate all the buttons with values contained in the array
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: Child buttons that are active (pressed)
classitems.name: activeChildren

classitems.description: Default label of the button. Not need if used as a block component
classitems.name: defaultText

classitems.description: Property to disable the button
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description: Set the type of the button, either 'button' or 'submit'
classitems.name: buttonType

classitems.description: Set the 'active' class to apply active/pressed CSS styling
classitems.name: active

classitems.description:
Property for block level buttons

See the [Bootstrap docs](http://getbootstrap.com/css/#buttons-sizes)
classitems.name: block

classitems.description: If toggle property is true, clicking the button will toggle the active state
classitems.name: toggle

classitems.description: If button is active and this is set, the icon property will match this property
classitems.name: iconActive

classitems.description: If button is inactive and this is set, the icon property will match this property
classitems.name: iconInactive

classitems.description: Class(es) (e.g. glyphicons or font awesome) to use as a button icon This will render a element in front of the button's label
classitems.name: icon

classitems.description:
Supply a value that will be associated with this button. This will be send
as a parameter of the default action triggered when clicking the button
classitems.name: value

classitems.description:
State of the button. The button's label (if not used as a block component) will be set to the
`<state>Text` property.
This property will automatically be set when using a click action that supplies the callback with an promise
classitems.name: textState

classitems.description: Set this to true to reset the state. A typical use case is to bind this attribute with ember-data isDirty flag.
classitems.name: reset

classitems.description: This will reset the state property to 'default', and with that the button's label to defaultText
classitems.name: resetState

classitems.description:
Click handler. This will send the default "action" action, with the following parameters:
* value of the button (that is the value of the "value" property)
* original event object of the click event
* callback: call that with a promise object, and the buttons state will automatically set to "pending", "resolved" and/or "rejected"
classitems.name: click

classitems.description: Collapsed/expanded state
classitems.name: collapsed

classitems.description: True if this item is expanded
classitems.name: active

classitems.description: true if the component is currently transitioning
classitems.name: transitioning

classitems.description: The size of the element when collapsed. Defaults to 0.
classitems.name: collapsedSize

classitems.description: The size of the element when expanded. When null the value is calculated automatically to fit the containing elements.
classitems.name: expandedSize

classitems.description: Usually the size (height) of the element is only set while transitioning, and reseted afterwards. Set to true to always set a size.
classitems.name: resetSizeWhenNotCollapsing

classitems.description:
The direction (height/width) of the collapse animation.
When setting this to 'width' you should also define custom CSS transitions for the width property, as the Bootstrap
CSS does only support collapsible elements for the height direction.
classitems.name: collapseDimension

classitems.description: Triggers the show transition
classitems.name: show

classitems.description: Get the size of the element when expanded
classitems.name: getExpandedSize

classitems.description: Triggers the hide transition
classitems.name: hide

classitems.description: Defaults to a `<ul>` tag. Change for other types of dropdown menus.
classitems.name: tagName

classitems.description: Alignment of the menu, either "left" or "right"
classitems.name: align

classitems.description: Defaults to a `<a>` tag. Change for other types of dropdown toggles.
classitems.name: tagName

classitems.description: Computed property to generate a `href="#"` attribute when `tagName` is "a".
classitems.name: href

classitems.description: This property reflects the state of the dropdown, whether it is open or closed.
classitems.name: open

classitems.description: By default clicking on an open dropdown menu will close it. Set this property to false for the menu to stay open.
classitems.name: closeOnMenuClick

classitems.description: jQuery click event name, namespaced to this component's instance to prevent interference between multiple dropdowns.
classitems.name: clickEventName

classitems.description: A computed property to generate the suiting class for the dropdown container, either "dropdown" or "btn-group".
classitems.name: containerClass

classitems.description: This property is "button" if the toggle element is an instance of {{#crossLink "Components.DropdownButton"}}{{/crossLink}}, otherwise "toggle".
classitems.name: toggleType

classitems.description: Handler for click events to close the dropdown
classitems.name: closeOnClickHandler

classitems.description: Text to display within a `<label>` tag.
classitems.name: label

classitems.description:
The type of the control widget.
Supported types:

* 'text'
* 'checkbox'
* 'select'
* 'textarea'
* any other type will use an input tag with the `controlType` value as the type attribute (for e.g. HTML5 input
types like 'email'), and the same layout as the 'text' type
classitems.name: controlType

classitems.description:
The value of the control element is bound to this property. You can bind it to some controller property to
get/set the control element's value:

```hbs
{{bs-form-element controlType="email" label="Email" placeholder="Email" value=email}}
```

Note: you loose the ability to validate this form element by directly binding to its value. It is recommended
to use the `property` feature instead.
classitems.name: value

classitems.description:
The property name of the form element's `model` (by default the `model` of its parent `Components.Form`) that this
form element should represent. The control element's value will automatically be bound to the model property's
value.

Using this property enables form validation on this element.
classitems.name: property

classitems.description: Control element's HTML5 placeholder attribute
classitems.name: placeholder

classitems.description: Control element's HTML5 disabled attribute
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description: Control element's HTML5 required attribute
classitems.name: required

classitems.description: Control element's HTML5 autofocus attribute
classitems.name: autofocus

classitems.description: Control element's name attribute
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
An array of objects containing the selection of choices for multiple choice style form controls, e.g. select
boxes.

```hbs
{{bs-form-element controlType="select" choices=countries choiceLabelProperty="name" choiceValueProperty="id" label="Country" value=selectedCountry}}
```

Be sure to also set the `choiceValueProperty` and `choiceLabelProperty` properties.
classitems.name: choices

classitems.description: The property of the `choices` array of objects, containing the value of the choice, e.g. the select box option.
classitems.name: choiceValueProperty

classitems.description: The property of the `choices` array of objects, containing the label of the choice, e.g. the select box option.
classitems.name: choiceLabelProperty

classitems.description: Textarea's rows attribute (ignored for other `controlType`s)
classitems.name: rows

classitems.description: Textarea's cols attribute (ignored for other `controlType`s)
classitems.name: cols

classitems.description: The model used for validation. Defaults to the parent `Components.Form`'s `model`
classitems.name: model

classitems.description: The array of error messages from the `model`'s validation.
classitems.name: errors

classitems.description: Set a validating state for async validations
classitems.name: isValidating

classitems.description: If `true` form validation markup is rendered (requires a validatable `model`).
classitems.name: showValidation

classitems.description:
The validation ("error" or "success") or null if no validation is to be shown. Automatically computed from the
models validation state.
classitems.name: validation

classitems.description: True for text field `controlType`s
classitems.name: useIcons

classitems.description:
The form layout used for the markup generation (see http://getbootstrap.com/css/#forms):

* 'horizontal'
* 'vertical'
* 'inline'

Defaults to the parent `form`'s `formLayout` property.
classitems.name: formLayout

classitems.description:
The Bootstrap grid class for form labels within a horizontal layout form. Defaults to the value of the same
property of the parent form. The corresponding grid class for form controls is automatically computed.
classitems.name: horizontalLabelGridClass

classitems.description: Computed property that specifies the Bootstrap grid class for form controls within a horizontal layout form.
classitems.name: horizontalInputGridClass

classitems.description:
Computed property that specifies the Bootstrap offset grid class for form controls within a horizontal layout
form, that have no label.
classitems.name: horizontalInputOffsetGridClass

classitems.description: ID for input field and the corresponding label's "for" attribute
classitems.name: formElementId

classitems.description: Reference to the parent `Components.Form` class.
classitems.name: form

classitems.description:
Setup validation properties. This method acts as a hook for external validation
libraries to overwrite. In case of failed validations the `errors` property should contain an array of error messages.
classitems.name: setupValidations

classitems.description:
Listen for focusOut events from the control element to automatically set `showValidation` to true to enable
form validation markup rendering.
classitems.name: focusOut

classitems.description:
Whether to show validation state icons.
See http://getbootstrap.com/css/#forms-control-validation
classitems.name: useIcons

classitems.description: Computed property which is true if the form group is in a validation state
classitems.name: hasValidation

classitems.description: Computed property which is true if the form group is showing a validation icon
classitems.name: hasFeedback

classitems.description:
The icon classes to be used for a feedback icon in a "success" validation state.
Defaults to the usual glyphicon classes. This is ignored, and no feedback icon is
rendered if `useIcons` is false.

You can change this globally by setting the `formValidationSuccessIcon` property of
the ember-bootstrap configuration in your config/environment.js file. If your are
using FontAwesome for example:

```js
ENV['ember-bootstrap'] = {
  formValidationSuccessIcon: 'fa fa-check'
}
```
classitems.name: successIcon

classitems.description:
The icon classes to be used for a feedback icon in a "error" validation state.
Defaults to the usual glyphicon classes. This is ignored, and no feedback icon is
rendered if `useIcons` is false.

You can change this globally by setting the `formValidationErrorIcon` property of
the ember-bootstrap configuration in your config/environment.js file. If your are
using FontAwesome for example:

```js
ENV['ember-bootstrap'] = {
  formValidationErrorIcon: 'fa fa-times'
}
```
classitems.name: errorIcon

classitems.description:
The icon classes to be used for a feedback icon in a "warning" validation state.
Defaults to the usual glyphicon classes. This is ignored, and no feedback icon is
rendered if `useIcons` is false.

You can change this globally by setting the `formValidationWarningIcon` property of
the ember-bootstrap configuration in your config/environment.js file. If your are
using FontAwesome for example:

```js
ENV['ember-bootstrap'] = {
  formValidationWarningIcon: 'fa fa-warning'
}
```
classitems.name: warningIcon
infoIcon

classitems.description:
Set to a validation state to render the form-group with a validation style.
See http://getbootstrap.com/css/#forms-control-validation

The default states of "success", "warning" and "error" are supported by Bootstrap out-of-the-box.
But you can use custom states as well. This will set a has-<state> class, and (if `useIcons`is true)
a feedback whose class is taken from the <state>Icon property
classitems.name: validation

classitems.description: Bootstrap form class name (computed)
classitems.name: layoutClass

classitems.description:
Set a model that this form should represent. This serves several purposes:

* child `Components.FormElement`s can access and bind to this model by their `property`
* when the model supports validation by using the [ember-validations](https://github.com/dockyard/ember-validations) mixin,
child `Components.FormElement`s will look at the validation information of their `property` and render their form group accordingly.
Moreover the form's `submit` event handler will validate the model and deny submitting if the model is not validated successfully.
classitems.name: model

classitems.description: Set the layout of the form to either "vertical", "horizontal" or "inline". See http://getbootstrap.com/css/#forms-inline and http://getbootstrap.com/css/#forms-horizontal
classitems.name: formLayout

classitems.description: Check if validating the model is supported. This needs to be implemented by another addon.
classitems.name: hasValidator

classitems.description:
The Bootstrap grid class for form labels. This is used by the `Components.FormElement` class as a default for the
whole form.
classitems.name: horizontalLabelGridClass

classitems.description: If set to true pressing enter will submit the form, even if no submit button is present
classitems.name: submitOnEnter

classitems.description: An array of `Components.FormElement`s that are children of this form.
classitems.name: childFormElements

classitems.description:
Validate hook which will return a promise that will either resolve if the model is valid
or reject if it's not. This should be overridden to add validation support.
A handler called before the form is validated (if possible) and submitted.
classitems.name: before

classitems.description: A handler called when submit has been triggered and the model has passed all validations (if present).
classitems.name: action

params.name: Object
params.description: result The returned result from the validate method

classitems.description: A handler called when validation of the model has failed.
classitems.name: invalid

classitems.description:
Submit handler that will send the default action ("action") to the controller when submitting the form.

If there is a supplied `model` that supports validation (`hasValidator`) the model will be validated before, and
only if validation is successful the default action will be sent. Otherwise an "invalid" action will be sent, and
all the `showValidation` property of all child `Components.FormElement`s will be set to true, so error state and
messages will be shown automatically.
classitems.name: submit

classitems.description: The title of the modal, visible in the modal header. Is ignored if `header` is false.
classitems.name: title

classitems.description: Display a close button (x icon) in the corner of the modal header.
classitems.name: closeButton

classitems.description: Set to false to disable fade animations.
classitems.name: fade

classitems.description: Used to apply Bootstrap's "in" class
classitems.name: in

classitems.description: Closes the modal when escape key is pressed.
classitems.name: keyboard

classitems.description:
Generate a modal header component automatically. Set to false to disable. In this case you would want to include an
instance of {{#crossLink "Components.ModalHeader"}}{{/crossLink}} in the components block template
classitems.name: header

classitems.description:
Generate a modal body component automatically. Set to false to disable. In this case you would want to include an
instance of {{#crossLink "Components.ModalBody"}}{{/crossLink}} in the components block template.

Always set this to false if `header` and/or `footer` is false!
classitems.name: body

classitems.description:
Generate a modal footer component automatically. Set to false to disable. In this case you would want to include an
instance of {{#crossLink "Components.ModalFooter"}}{{/crossLink}} in the components block template
classitems.name: footer

classitems.description:
Property for size styling, set to null (default), 'lg' or 'sm'

Also see the [Bootstrap docs](http://getbootstrap.com/javascript/#modals-sizes)
classitems.name: size

classitems.description: If true clicking on the backdrop will close the modal.
classitems.name: backdropClose

classitems.description: Name of the size class
classitems.name: sizeClass

classitems.description:
The title of the default close button. Will be ignored (i.e. no close button) if you provide your own block
template.
classitems.name: closeTitle

classitems.description:
The title of the submit button (primary button). Will be ignored (i.e. no button) if set to null or if you provide
your own block template.
classitems.name: submitTitle

classitems.description:
Set to true to disable the submit button. If you bind this to some property that indicates if submitting is allowed
(form validation for example) this can be used to prevent the user from pressing the submit button.
classitems.name: submitDisabled

classitems.description: The action to send to the parent modal component when the modal footer's form is submitted
classitems.name: submitAction

classitems.description: Show a close button (x icon)
classitems.name: closeButton

classitems.description: The title to display in the modal header
classitems.name: title

classitems.description: Visibility of the modal. Toggle to to show/hide with CSS transitions.
classitems.name: open

classitems.description: The title of the modal, visible in the modal header. Is ignored if `header` is false.
classitems.name: title

classitems.description: Display a close button (x icon) in the corner of the modal header.
classitems.name: closeButton

classitems.description: Set to false to disable fade animations.
classitems.name: fade

classitems.description: Used to apply Bootstrap's "in" class
classitems.name: in

classitems.description: Use a semi-transparent modal background to hide the rest of the page.
classitems.name: backdrop

classitems.description: Closes the modal when escape key is pressed.
classitems.name: keyboard

classitems.description:
If true clicking a close button will hide the modal automatically.
If you want to handle hiding the modal by yourself, you can set this to false and use the closeAction to
implement your custom logic.
classitems.name: autoClose

classitems.description:
Generate a modal header component automatically. Set to false to disable. In this case you would want to include an
instance of {{#crossLink "Components.ModalHeader"}}{{/crossLink}} in the components block template
classitems.name: header

classitems.description:
Generate a modal body component automatically. Set to false to disable. In this case you would want to include an
instance of {{#crossLink "Components.ModalBody"}}{{/crossLink}} in the components block template.

Always set this to false if `header` and/or `footer` is false!
classitems.name: body

classitems.description:
Generate a modal footer component automatically. Set to false to disable. In this case you would want to include an
instance of {{#crossLink "Components.ModalFooter"}}{{/crossLink}} in the components block template
classitems.name: footer

classitems.description: The id of the `.modal` element.
classitems.name: modalId

classitems.description: The jQuery object of the `.modal` element.
classitems.name: modalElement

classitems.description: The id of the backdrop element.
classitems.name: backdropId

classitems.description: The jQuery object of the backdrop element.
classitems.name: backdropElement

classitems.description: Use CSS transitions when showing/hiding the modal?
classitems.name: usesTransition

classitems.description:
Property for size styling, set to null (default), 'lg' or 'sm'

Also see the [Bootstrap docs](http://getbootstrap.com/javascript/#modals-sizes)
classitems.name: size

classitems.description: If true clicking on the backdrop will close the modal.
classitems.name: backdropClose

classitems.description: If true component will render in place, rather than be wormholed.
classitems.name: renderInPlace

classitems.description:
The action to be sent when the modal footer's submit button (if present) is pressed.
Note that if your modal body contains a form (e.g. {{#crossLink "Components.Form"}}{{/crossLink}}) this action will
not be triggered. Instead a submit event will be triggered on the form itself. See the class description for an
example.
classitems.name: submitAction

classitems.description:
The action to be sent when the modal is closing.
This will be triggered by pressing the modal header's close button (x button) or the modal footer's close button.
Note that this will happen before the modal is hidden from the DOM, as the fade transitions will still need some
time to finish. Use the `closedAction` if you need the modal to be hidden when the action triggers.

You can set `autoClose` to false to prevent closing the modal automatically, and do that in your closeAction by
setting `open` to false.
classitems.name: closeAction

classitems.description: The action to be sent after the modal has been completely hidden (including the CSS transition).
classitems.name: closedAction

classitems.description:
The action to be sent when the modal is opening.
This will be triggered immediately after the modal is shown (so it's safe to access the DOM for
size calculations and the like). This means that if fade=true, it will be shown in between the
backdrop animation and the fade animation.
classitems.name: openAction

classitems.description: The action to be sent after the modal has been completely shown (including the CSS transition).
classitems.name: openedAction

classitems.description: Give the modal (or its autofocus element) focus
classitems.name: takeFocus

classitems.description: Show the modal
classitems.name: show

classitems.description: Hide the modal
classitems.name: hide

classitems.description: Clean up after modal is hidden and call closedAction
classitems.name: hideModal

classitems.description: SHow/hide the backdrop
classitems.name: handleBackdrop

classitems.description: Attach/Detach resize event listeners
classitems.name: resize

classitems.description: The lower limit of the value range
classitems.name: minValue

classitems.description: The upper limit of the value range
classitems.name: maxValue

classitems.description: The value the progress bar should represent
classitems.name: value
showLabel

classitems.description: Create a striped effect, see http://getbootstrap.com/components/#progress-striped
classitems.name: striped

classitems.description: Animate the stripes, see http://getbootstrap.com/components/#progress-animated
classitems.name: animate

classitems.description: Specify to how many digits the progress bar label should be rounded.
classitems.name: roundDigits

classitems.description: The percentage of `value`
classitems.name: percent

classitems.description: The percentage of `value`, rounded to `roundDigits` digits
classitems.name: percentRounded

classitems.description: Array of registered child components
classitems.name: children

classitems.description: Register a component as a child of this parent
classitems.name: registerChild

classitems.description: Remove the child component from this parent component
classitems.name: removeChild

classitems.description: The default action is set to "toggleDropdown" on the parent {{#crossLink "Components.Dropdown"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: action

classitems.description: Prefix for the size class, e.g. "btn" for button size classes ("btn-lg", "btn-sm" etc.)
classitems.name: classTypePrefix

classitems.description:
Property for size styling, set to 'lg', 'sm' or 'xs'

Also see the [Bootstrap docs](http://getbootstrap.com/css/#buttons-sizes)
classitems.name: size

classitems.description: Prefix for the type class, e.g. "btn" for button type classes ("btn-primary2 etc.)
classitems.name: classTypePrefix

classitems.description:
Property for type styling

For the available types see the [Bootstrap docs](http://getbootstrap.com/css/#buttons-options) (use without "btn-" prefix)
classitems.name: type

Missing item type
Validate hook which will return a promise that will either resolve if the model is valid
or reject if it's not. This should be overridden to add validation support.
